content: the traditional style and light blue color reminded me of artwork from the tale of peter rabbit the yarn used was bernat baby sport in pale blue and was crochet with a g/6 hook between the blanket and my gauge swatch and nearly used every last inch of the yarn ball the finished size of the blanket using the suggested yarn and hook is approximately 31 x 36 but size can easily be adjusted by adding more repeats of the patter or using a thicker yarn and larger hook to work gauge swatch chain 27 and work in pattern instructions my finished gauge swatch was 5 across and 5 25 tall **pattern instructions** chain 147 1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and across turn - 145 double_crochet 2 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet here and throughout *double_crochet next double_crochet chain 1 skip next double_crochet* repeat across to last double_crochet and top of chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet and in top of chain from previous row turn 3 chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet *chain 1 and skip next double_crochet double_crochet 19x* repeat 7 times ch1 skip next double_crochet double_crochet next stitch and in top of chain 3 of previous row turn 4 repeat row 3 5 repeat row 3 6 chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet *chain 1 and skip next double_crochet double_crochet 9x chain 2 and skip 1 double_crochet double_crochet 9x* repeat 7 times chain 1 skip next double_crochet double_crochet next stitch and in top of chain 3 of previous row turn 7 chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet *chain 1 and skip next double_crochet double_crochet 7x chain 2 and skip over 2 double_crochet of previous row single_crochet in opening made by chain 2 of previous row chain 2 and skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet 7x* repeat 7 times chain 1 skip next double_crochet double_crochet next stitch and in top of chain 3 of previous row turn 8 chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet *chain 1 and skip next double_crochet double_crochet 7x double_crochet 2x in chain 2 of previous row chain 1 and skip over single_crochet of previous row double_crochet 2x in chain 2 of previous row double_crochet 7x* repeat 7 times chain 1 skip next double_crochet double_crochet next stitch and in top of chain 3 of previous row turn 9 chain 3 double_crochet next double_crochet *chain 1 and skip next double_crochet double_crochet 9x double_crochet in chain 1 of previous row double_crochet 9x* repeat 7 times chain 1 skip next double_crochet double_crochet next stitch and in top of chain 3 of previous row turn 10 repeat row 3 11 repeat row 3 12 repeat row 2 13 chain 3 double_crochet in each double_crochet and chain 1 space of previous row at this point you could tie off and weave in strings the edges would look like my final photo i worked a more finished edge as follows 1 at the end of row 13 chain 1 and turn blanket so you can work down the side work 2 slip stitches into the
